The Sturgis Girls golf team used 4 personal best scores to help finish 2nd at the Gull Lake Mini Invitational held at Stonehenge. Carli Sanford finished 2nd overall individually with a career best 83 (43-40). Madisen Percival followed with a career best 91 (50-41) good for 4th overall individually. The Lady Trojans shot a 391 as a team with Gull Lake winning with a 377.

"We are very happy with the result as we are working hard on a few things with our games. We wanted to bounce back after shooting a disappointing 216 at Binder. The girls were very focused and had fun."

SPS Families,

County schools have been asked to pass on this information on behalf of Rebecca Burns, Health Officer at our Local Health Department. There is community transmission of COVID-19 in St. Joseph County and our number of positive individuals is currently rising rapidly. On Friday, June 12th there were 163 total known cases in St. Joseph county and we ended the week with 197. This is a total increase of 34 new cases or a 21% increase in just one week. Folks, we are losing to this virus right now. There are several things that you can do to help:

Wear a mask when you are out in public and insist that your family members do as well.

Do not congregate in groups.

When you are inside with other people for any period of time, wear a mask and if others are not wearing a mask, consider leaving.

There is also misinformation about testing. If you are in close contact to a person with a known case of COVID-19, you must go into quarantine for 14 days. Even if you get tested sometime within that 14 day period and the result is negative.
